intro: Jussiaea repens f. intermedia, commonly known as the creeping jussiaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically forms dense mats on moist soils. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with four petals and a prominent yellow or red calyx. It is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in waterlogged or sandy soils.
